Sequence Information.Source: circularization, amino acid SUBSTITUTION, defensin analog, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (87.88%) toRabbit neutrophil peptide 1 NP-1R: 30%; G: 18%.Activity: low salt, active against E. coli (MIC 1.6 ug/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC 2.0 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 2.5 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 2.5 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes (MIC 1.8 ug/ml), and C. albicans (MIC 19.9 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:E. coli (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:S. typhimurium (100 mM), NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:K. pneumoniae (100 mM), NaCl-insensitive:L. monocytogenes (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans (100 mM).In vitro toxicity: human RBC, not hemo.lytic (HC50 3188 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Yu Q, Lehrer RI, Tam JP.2000
Literature Information.Title: Engineered salt-insensitive alpha-defensins with end-to-end circularized structures
